Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately identify and draw a variety of habitats, including both land (e.g., playground, garden, forest) and water habitats (e.g., pond, stream), with attention to detail.

The student can draw a diverse array of living things within each habitat, such as specific trees, bushes, various grasses, and specific animals like lizards, squirrels, or fish, showing a clear understanding of which organisms belong in which habitat.
The student can illustrate detailed comparisons between the different kinds of living things found in various habitats, noting specific differences in diversity and population.

The student can effectively use patterns and symbols in their drawings to represent and communicate how plant and animal diversity varies across different habitats, demonstrating an advanced grasp of ecological concepts.
CANNOT: The student might occasionally miss labeling specific organisms or habitats even though they are drawn correctly, due to oversight rather than misunderstanding.
The student might show minor inconsistencies in the scale or proportion of living things relative to their environment, though this does not detract from the accuracy of the representation.
